projects.title: Film Club
projects.description: This was a group project, using numerous node packages including sequelize, passport, express and anime to build an interactive film review site with a SQL database to store user reviews and account info.

projects.title: Meme It
projects.description: This was a group project in my coding bootcamp. Using Imgflip API and Google translate, we built a web app to allow users to create memes, translate them into other languages and store them locally.

projects.title: Sorter Simluation
projects.description: This was my final project from CS50. Inspired by my time working at UPS, I built a simulation of a tilt tray sorter which could be adjusted based on the layout and number of people in different positions.

projects.title: Employee Lookup
projects.description: This is an app which I used to familiarize myself with react. It pulls a list of random names and pictures and builds an employee list that can be searched or ordered.

projects.title: Budget Tracker
projects.description: This is an app which uses indexedDb and service workers to allow a budgeting tool to work offline as long as the page has been loaded, and send the data to a Mongo DB as soon as connection is re-established.

projects.title: Note Taker
projects.description: This app uses express routes to create a simple note taker app. each note can be deleted or viewed individually and is saved in local storage.

projects.title: README Generator
projects.description: This is a very useful app which uses inquirer.js for a command line interface which takes in the user's inputs to automatically format a README.md file.
